channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024110417
item.description:
Report E-2024110417

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-18
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NMP experienced a UN2924 PQ-8 release from a 270-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 150-gallons of product released to a 53’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor and an 80’ x 40’ area of the asphalt lot below due to a forklift puncture to the tote. A vac truck was dispatched which transferred the material from the damaged tote into a new one. The vac truck was then utilized to collect all free-standing liquid. Sodium bicarbonate and absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the impacted areas. One 55-gallon poly drum of recovered liquid product was generated. Crew then generated (10) 55-gallon poly drums of impacted absorbents, boom, PPE, and the empty damaged cut up poly tote. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024110526
item.description:
Report X-2024110526

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-22T12:30:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-31
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 350000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: UTLX 130094, loaded HCL tank car, was reported by the LA City FD to be releasing at an uncontrolled rate from the bottom shell of the car in the 4th St yard in Los Angeles. UPRR Hazmat manager made entry with Los Angeles Fire to apply a mag patch kit. During entry we found a hole in the bottom shell of tank car UTLX 130094 that was caused by a rubber line failure causing HCL to release from the shell of the tank car. A mag seal patch was applied to stop the release.

item.title: Report X-2024110648
item.description:
Report X-2024110648

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-20T12:31:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-03
  • City: EVERETT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Tank car GATX 109865 was reported to be leaking with visible vapor release and icing on the protective housing while in the BNSF Everett Delta yard. The car was isolated and responders were mobilized to inspect. Upon inspection, it was found that the sample line valve was cracked near the threads to the sample line nipple. A Midland kit was installed to control the release. GATX 109865 was transferred to the FURX 130095. The cracked sample valve was removed from the car and a cap installed to secure the car for movement under an OTMA to shop for repairs. Release estimates are based upon evaluation of outage at the time of the response in comparison to original outage. All released Butane dissipated to atmosphere.

item.title: Report E-2024100729
item.description:
Report E-2024100729

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-20T12:31:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-03
  • City: Phoenix
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CANYON STATE PROPANE, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 244740
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Jesse Marquez-Zamora was traveling northbound on freeway 101 at 50 mph on 10-3-2024 at approximately 820am. The vehicle traveling in front of Jesse proceeded to heavy brake. Jesse then proceeded to apply his brakes, but it was not enough to stop his propane bobtail. Jesse then attempted to maneuver around the vehicle in front of him to the left, this was when Jesse lost control of the truck. Jesse's truck then proceeded to hit the vehicle in front of him and rolled 2 times, there were a total of 4 vehicles involved. During the rollover a piped valve was knocked off causing the release of approximately 2240 gallons of propane. Jesse and another individual were taken to the ER for evaluation then released

item.title: Report I-2024110025
item.description:
Report I-2024110025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-20T12:31:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-03
  • City: Columbia
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: POPE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On October 3,2024 EJ Pope made a delivery to Pop's Fuel. A minor spill was reported by the driver. On October 8,2024, EJ Pope was notified that a larger release had occurred. First Call Environmental was dispatched to inspect the area and perform the required cleanup. First Call Environmental responded and inspected the site. First Call Environmental confirmed that no waterways were affected by the release, however some impacted soil was located. Completion of site cleanup is pending.

item.title: Report E-2024110263
item.description:
Report E-2024110263

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: MARIETTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On November 7, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of X-111 55GL was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 145-gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized soda ash, absorbents, and hand tools to remove the released product. A tote transfer was completed. All impacted materials were containerized in seven (7) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024110290
item.description:
Report E-2024110290

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-18T12:24:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-06
  • City: BUTLER
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS STEEL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On November 6, 2024, a spill incident occurred at the Heidtman Butler facility involving an overfill of a tanker truck. During a product transfer operation, the driver failed to actively monitor the flow from the dome of the tanker truck, which is required to prevent overflow. Instead, the driver was standing at the back of the trailer, timing the transfer rather than visually overseeing the product flow from the dome. As a result, approximately 300 gallons of ferrous chloride solution (372 pounds) overflowed from the tanker, spilling onto the facility’s limestone gravel bed.
